intro: Argemone platyceras var. hunnemannii, commonly known as the narrow-leaf argemone, is a flowering plant native to parts of Mexico and the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain elliptical, black seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
